intro: Copaifera nitida, commonly known as the white copaiba, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and elongated, narrow leaves. The plant is notable for its aromatic resins, which have been traditionally used in medicine and perfumery. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in axillary or terminal inflorescences. The tree thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests.
